Package com.rb.biz.types.trading

Class RoundingScale

java.lang.Object
com.rb.biz.types.trading.RoundingScale
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<RoundingScale>
public class RoundingScale
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<RoundingScale>
A specification of how many digits of precision to use.

For example, if x = 123.1234, then the effect of each of the following rounding scales would be: 

  1.   x = 123     
  2.   x = 123.1   
  3.   x = 123.12  
  4.   x = 123.123

Rounding scales can also be negative, indicating rounding to powers of ten: 

  1.   x = 100 
  2.   x = 120

    • roundSimplistically

      public double roundSimplistically​(double value)
      Implements the usual imperfect rounding of scaling down a number, rounding it as an int, and scaling it up. We add 'simplistically' to the name of this method, just to be clear to the caller. In many cases this is good enough (e.g. writing numbers to JSON files for visualizations).

    • floorSimplistically

      public double floorSimplistically​(double value)
      Implements an imperfect flooring of scaling down a number, rounding it as an int, and scaling it up. We add 'simplistically' to the name of this method, just to be clear to the caller. In many cases this is good enough (e.g. writing numbers to JSON files for visualizations).

    • ceilingSimplistically

      public double ceilingSimplistically​(double value)
      Implements an imperfect ceiling operation of scaling down a number, rounding it as an int, and scaling it up. We add 'simplistically' to the name of this method, just to be clear to the caller. In many cases this is good enough (e.g. writing numbers to JSON files for visualizations).
